Module Basics
Package basics.math

Class DoubleIntervals

java.lang.Object
basics.math.DoubleIntervals
public class DoubleIntervals
extends java.lang.Object
Intervals are a set of [from_d...to_d], where each number is a double.
Author:
Jörg Roth (Joerg.Roth@Wireless-earth.org)

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    DoubleIntervals()
    Creates an empty set of intervals.
    DoubleIntervals​(double from, double to)
    Creates a set that contains a single interval.
    DoubleIntervals​(DoubleIntervals ints)
    Copying constructor.

    Modifier and Type Method Description

    Checks if the given interval set completely resides in the intervals.

      public int countIntervals()
      Number of individual intervals in the set.

      count of intervals

    • getInterval

      public double[] getInterval​(int i)
      Returns an individual interval of the set.
      Parameters:
      i - interval number 0...cntIntervals()-1
      Returns:
      interval as array of 2

    • addInterval

      public void addInterval​(double from, double to)
      Add an interval to all intervals.
      Parameters:
      from - from
      to - to

    • removeInterval

      public void removeInterval​(double from, double to)
      Remove an interval from all intervals. Note that the interval the borders may still be inside the original sets. If the original set was 1.0d...4.0d and we remove 2.0d...3.0d we get 1.0d...2.0d and 3.0d...4.0d (i.e. 2.0d and 3.0d still reside in the set).
      Parameters:
      from - from
      to - to

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object

    • contains

      public boolean contains​(double number)
      Checks if a number is part of the interval set.
      Parameters:
      number - number to check
      Returns:
      true if the number is in one of the intervals

    • contains

      public boolean contains​(double number1, double number2)
      Checks if an interval completely resides in the intervals (i.e. there is one interval that completely contains the given interval).
      Parameters:
      number1 - interval from
      number2 - interval to
      Returns:
      true if the intervals is in one of the intervals

    • contains

      public boolean contains​(DoubleIntervals ints)
      Checks if the given interval set completely resides in the intervals.
      Parameters:
      ints - other intervals
      Returns:
      true if contains the other intervals

    • overlaps

      public boolean overlaps​(double number1, double number2)
      Checks if an interval overlaps resides with the intervals (i.e. there is at least one interval that overlaps with the given interval).
      Parameters:
      number1 - interval from
      number2 - interval to
      Returns:
      true if overlaps

    • overlaps

      public boolean overlaps​(DoubleIntervals ints)
      Checks if the given interval set overlaps with in the intervals.
      Parameters:
      ints - other intervals
      Returns:
      true if overlaps

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      No intervals at all?
      Returns:
      true if empty

    • min

      public double min()
      Minimum number of all intervals.
      Returns:
      minimum value
      Throws:
      java.lang.ArithmeticException - if set ist empty.

    • max

      public double max()
      Maximum number of all intervals.
      Returns:
      maximum value
      Throws:
      java.lang.ArithmeticException - if set ist empty.

    • sumIntervals

      public double sumIntervals()
      Returns the sum of all intervals (i.e. sum over all i of to_i-from_i)
      Returns:
      sum

    • split

      public DoubleIntervals[] split​(double number)
      Splits an interval set into two sets. The first goes up to the given number, the seconds starts from the given number. Note that one of the sets can be empty. Further note that number can be in both sets.
      Parameters:
      number - border to split
      Returns:
      two interval sets

    • inverse

      public DoubleIntervals inverse()
      Returns the inverse set of the interval set. The inverse set contains the "wholes" of the original set.
      Returns:
      the inverse set
      Throws:
      java.lang.ArithmeticException - if set ist empty.

    • union

      public static DoubleIntervals union​(DoubleIntervals ints1, DoubleIntervals ints2)
      Computes the union set of two interval sets. The result contains those numbers that are at least in one of the sets.
      Parameters:
      ints1 - first operand set
      ints2 - second operand set
      Returns:
      the union set

    • difference

      public static DoubleIntervals difference​(DoubleIntervals ints1, DoubleIntervals ints2)
      Computes the difference set of two interval sets. The result contains those numbers that are in the first set and not in the second set.
      Parameters:
      ints1 - first operand set
      ints2 - second operand set
      Returns:
      the difference set
